job_title: C++ Software Engineer, AI Open-Source Software
job_description:
• Experience with open-source software development, engaging with upstream reviewers, and reviewing PRs.
• Highly proficient in C/C++, object-oriented programming, and tools such as debuggers and profilers AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Demonstrated ability to write high-quality code with strong attention to detail Experience with software development processes such as Agile, Scrum, or Sprint Experience with GPU kernel and parallel programming: ROCm, HIP, or CUDA Experience with both training and inferencing machine learning models Experience with Linux and containerized environments (e.
• , Docker) Experience with source code control systems such as GitHub Experience in performance analysis and optimization.

• Become an expert on the Rivian mobile app framework and design system, and act as a resource for the larger team in translating cross-functional experiences into clean, reliable iOS/Android solutions.
• Stay aware of trends within industry UI/UX and feature offerings as needed to ensure designs are unique and pushing the envelope in the industry.
• Actively pursuing a degree or one closely related in Interaction Design, Human Factors, Product Design, or related discipline.
• Experience delivering end-to-end digital design and a portfolio that highlights solutions relating to those requirements.
• Must be currently pursuing a bachelors or masters degree at an accredited university.
• Specialize in experiences or features that require a major mobile app component.
• Translate desired experiences into clear, actionable requirements.
• Portfolio link required (with credentials for review).

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• The ideal candidate will have experience in Microchip firmware (MPLAB, Harmony), embedded Linux (ARM SoCs, Quartus), C++ GUI development with Qt, and networking (TCP/UDP).
• You'll translate customer needs into technical solutions and support project development end-to-end.
• Security clearance eligibility required (DoD preferred).
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
